name: Indigenous Politics and Law
description: This course explores key historical and contemporary issues in indigenous politics. Focusing on the contemporary political and legal mobilization of Indigenous peoples, it will examine their pursuit of self-government, land claims and resource development, treaty negotiations indigenous rights, and reconciliation. A primary focus will be the role of Canadaâ€™s courts, its political institutions, and federal and provincial political leaders in affecting the capacity of indigenous communities to realize their goals.
